Package mainBot

Class Bot

java.lang.Object
net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.ListenerAdapter
mainBot.Bot
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.EventListener
public class Bot
extends net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.ListenerAdapter
Description:
The "main" class that is responsible for initializing the bot, as well as housing any utility methods that fulfill common tasks for Discord, such as joining voice channels, or retrieving permissions for roles.
The execution of the program starts in the main method, which starts the launching process of the bot.
This launch process initalizes the configuration file, which contains any necessary information used for the bot to run, such as its API token. After confirming that the token, which is the most important piece of data, is stored successfully, then the start method is called.
This start process is responsible for initializing the bot application using the API token, as well as initalizing the guilds the bot is present in by setting up the proper roles and guild channels. After initializing each individual guild, the CommandObject and EventObject initializations are called. Finally, the GUI is initialized, displaying all the data that was generated here.
Once everything is initialized, the bot starts listening for events, either from a guild or from the GUI.

Date: August 24, 2021

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Harrison Hoggard

      public static boolean start() throws java.lang.InterruptedException, javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
      Description:
      This method is responsible for initializing each individual guild, initializing the commands and events, and finally initializing the GUI to display the generated data.
      Returns:
      false if the token wasn't generated in the config class true if everything was initialized

    • guildInit

      public static void guildInit​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Guild guild, int i)
      Description:
      Sets up each guild that the bot is either loaded up in, or joins while it is running. The set up involves verifying whether or not the general text channel, admin role, bot role, or silenced role are all created. If they aren't then the bot creates them with the correct attributes (permissions, position, etc.).
      Parameters:
      guild - a guild that the bot is in
      Since:
      1.0.0

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      json-object if the object was retrieved successfully; null if the object was not parsed successfully.

      1.0.0

      Description:
      The method inherited from the ListenerAdapter class. Whenever a message is sent to a guild that the bot is in, an event variable is passed, and the method below is executed.

    • shutdown

      public static void shutdown​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.TextChannel channel)
      Alternative shutdown method with a text channel variable as a parameter. Most appropriately used when the shutdown command was executed from a guild.
      Parameters:
      channel - text channel variable to send the message letting a user know the bot is shutting down.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • joinVC

      public static void joinVC​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.TextChannel textChannel, net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.VoiceChannel voiceChannel)
      Description:
      Responsible for connecting the bot to a guild's voice channel. If the bot is already connected to a channel, let the user know. Otherwise, connect to the requested voice channel.
      Parameters:
      textChannel - text channel to send the messages in.
      voiceChannel - voice channel for the bot to connect to.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • leaveVC

      public static void leaveVC​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.TextChannel textChannel)
      Description:
      Responsible for disconnected the bot from a guild's voice channel. If the bot is not connected to one, let the user know. Otherwise, disconnect the bot from the current channel.
      Parameters:
      textChannel - text channel to send the messages in.
      Since:
      1.0.0
